info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 18 at 5:41PM CDT until May 18 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Callahan County in west central Texas...
* Until 845 PM CDT.
* At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen from Clyde to Eula. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clyde, Baird, Eula and Dudley.
This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 295 and 308.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... I-20 Frontage Roads west of Clyde, I-20 Frontage Roads near Baird, crossings along County Road 249, County Road 244 crossing South Prong Pecan Bayou, County Road 244 crossing North Prong Pecan Bayou, crossings along County Road 248, County Road 279 crossing Kaiser Creek and County Road 241 crossing North Prong Pecan Bayou.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 8:45 PM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 8:45 PM CDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 8:45 PM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 8:45 PM CDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
